name: The Most Amazing Vegan Pecan Pie
description: This is the most amazing vegan pecan pie! Sugary, rich and almost caramelly, no one would ever guess it's dairy and egg free. Gluten free option.
recipeIngredient: 1  Vegan Pie Crust (*see Notes for other options)
3/4 cup dark corn syrup (*or maple syrup/brown rice syrup)
2 cups coarse chopped pecans (10 oz), + more halves for decorating

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare a vegan pie crust (there is no need to pre-bake it) and line a pie plate with it. Stick the pie plate with the crust in the refrigerator until ready to fill it. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare a vegan pie crust (there is no need to pre-bake it) and line a pie plate with it. Stick the pie plate with the crust in the refrigerator until ready to fill it. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the flax eggs: In a small bowl, stir together the ground flaxseeds and water, then set aside to let thicken. This is your egg substitute.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the flax eggs: In a small bowl, stir together the ground flaxseeds and water, then set aside to let thicken. This is your egg substitute.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the melted vegan butter, corn syrup, flax eggs, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla and optional bourbon and whisk until well combined and smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the melted vegan butter, corn syrup, flax eggs, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla and optional bourbon and whisk until well combined and smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Roughly chop the pecans, but leave some whole if desired for decorating the top of the pie.
recipeInstructions.name: Roughly chop the pecans, but leave some whole if desired for decorating the top of the pie.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully spread the pecans evenly into the unbaked pie crust. Pour the sugar mixture into the pie crust over the pecans, evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully spread the pecans evenly into the unbaked pie crust. Pour the sugar mixture into the pie crust over the pecans, evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the pie for 60-65 minutes, until thick and bubbly and dark brown. It will still be quite liquidity until it cools so don’t cut into it right away. Use a pie crust shield after 15-20 minutes of baking if the crust starts to burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the pie for 60-65 minutes, until thick and bubbly and dark brown. It will still be quite liquidity until it cools so don’t cut into it right away. Use a pie crust shield after 15-20 minutes of baking if the crust starts to burn.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven, sprinkle with coarse salt, if desired, and let cool on a wire rack. Let the pie cool at room temperature for 30 minutes at room temperature, then move it to the refrigerator to chill for at least 3 hours. Overnight is even better.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice and serve the pie with coconut whipped cream, if desired. Enjoy!
